image.altText: An image purportedly of toppled Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, posted by Donald Trump on Truth Social.

props.synopsis: The US has "captured" Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife during an early-morning raid, which saw US military strike targets within the capital Caracas and in several other states. Follow live.

title.children: Venezuela hit in US strikes

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground, a police car near a home in the distance.

props.synopsis: NSW Police launch an investigation after an unidentified woman was found dead in a home in Goulburn on Saturday morning.

title.children: NSW Police investigating woman's death at Goulburn home

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers walking on a road blocked off with orange cones.

props.synopsis: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

title.children: Bikies allegedly sat waiting in hair salon before stabbing two men

image.altText: Two men kissing in front of a car.

props.synopsis: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

title.children: It was a photo that, if leaked, was illegal. Now it's on public display

props.synopsis: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.

title.children: Are modular homes the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?

image.altText: Two people shopping in a homewares store.

props.synopsis: Outlet centres around Australia were bustling on Boxing Day, but just down the road, some small retailers were feeling the sting. It's a trend that could shape the future of the Boxing Day sales.

title.children: 'We won't survive': Small retailers missing out on Boxing Day sales

image.altText: Julius Jungerth

props.synopsis: Hundreds of coin collectors forwent the late-night revelry of New Year's Eve in favour of an early morning visit to the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra, hoping to get their hands on the highly sought-after first coin of the year.

title.children: New coin celebrates 60 years of decimal currency

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone scrolling Facebook Marketplace.

props.synopsis: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that did not stop her from being scammed. Here is what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.

title.children: Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree are full of scammers. Here is how to avoid them

image.altText: A person scrapes bees from a board with a comb.

props.synopsis: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

title.children: Half of Canberra's beehives could be wiped out in two years. Here's why

image.altText: Reading 5

props.synopsis: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

title.children: What a 1925 summer reading list reveals about us

image.altText: Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The US has no intention of abandoning Taiwan. But it also has no intention of binding itself to an automatic war commitment on a timeline it does not control.

title.children: Two truths and a lie: Inside the China-Taiwan-US triangle

image.altText: A group of people standing together indoors, with several holding bottles with sparklers in them. Flames are visible nearby

props.synopsis: The prevalence of sparklers at a Swiss ski resort bar where dozens of people died in a fire this week has been branded "irresponsible", as authorities probe potential compliance issues there.

title.children: 'Irresponsible': Sparklers and venue become focus of Swiss bar blaze probe

image.altText: A pile of squashed coffee pods in a bin at Nowra.

props.synopsis: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

title.children: Millions of coffee pods go to landfill. Here's what is being done about it

image.altText: grok

props.synopsis: The generative AI chatbot integrated with X is under international scrutiny after reports it was filling the social media platform with sexually explicit images of children and women.

title.children: Grok under fire over complaints it let users undress minors in photos

image.altText: red electrical light in the sky

props.synopsis: A storm chaser captures a rare, split-second phenomenon above a thunderstorm.

title.children: 'I just screamed': Storm chaser captures rare red sprites in WA sky

image.altText: shot from a chopper, cattle running through floodwater

props.synopsis: Floodwaters remain in outback Queensland as graziers start to tally up livestock losses. Major flooding is possible in the north-west, with king tides forecast on the east coast.

title.children: Flooded Qld graziers to get $2m support as pilots muster stranded livestock

image.altText: Police at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police are searching for offenders, who are believed to have driven past in a silver SUV and fired shots at a young man, before fleeing the scene.

title.children: Teenager dies after shooting near police station in Melbourne's inner north

image.altText: Percy Island aerial

props.synopsis: Middle Percy Island is a rare gem where boaties can come ashore and wander through thousands of mementos left by travellers from across the globe.

title.children: A 'haven' for sailors on Queensland's coast, with tales of hidden treasure

image.altText: The surf safety message is going beyond "swim between the flags".

props.synopsis: Every summer, millions of Australians head to the beach and every year thousands are rescued by lifeguards or surf life savers, and even surfers or other bystanders.

title.children: Red and yellow flags can be confusing. Is it time to change them?

image.altText: An image of a secluded beach on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The man was pulled unresponsive from the water at a remote beach south of Wollongong after he was tangled in a float line.

title.children: NSW drownings toll rises after desperate attempts to save spearfisher

image.altText: Two men kissing in front of a car.

props.synopsis: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

title.children: It was a photo that, if leaked, was illegal. Now it's on public display

image.altText: The crowds at the SCG

props.synopsis: Officers will carry long-arm firearms as part of a bolstered police presence at the Ashes series in Sydney in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Police riot squad to carry long-arm firearms at Sydney Ashes series

image.altText: People stand behind a big banner at a protest.

props.synopsis: Eight journalists and social media commentators are sentenced to life imprisonment in Pakistan after being convicted of terrorism-related offences linked to online activity in support of jailed former prime minister Imran Khan.

title.children: Pakistan sentences journalists to life in prison over pro-Khan protests

image.altText: A man on a bus is blurred in the foreground, while three policemen holding large guns stand outside.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

title.children: The parts of Myanmar the military junta don't want you to see

image.altText: A large group of men stand in a street cheering and waving South Yemen flags.

props.synopsis: A military official from the separatist group, which is backed by the United Arab Emirates, said that 20 fighters had been killed in air raids by the Saudi-backed coalition in the south of the country.

title.children: Yemen separatists announce plans to split nation after 20 killed in Saudi-led strikes

image.altText: Cameron Green training in Sydney ahead of the fifth 2025/26 Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith launches an impassioned defence of the out-of-form Cameron Green, but cannot guarantee the all-rounder's place in Australia's XI for the final Ashes Test.

title.children: Aussies coy about Green's role in final Ashes Test

image.altText: A brown bird with black and red feathers surrounded by the words "most wanted".

props.synopsis: The sighting of a single red-whiskered bulbul in the wild might not seem like a big deal, but this invasive pest could put crops and the environment at risk.

title.children: How this little bird ended up on South Australia's most wanted list

image.altText: Beef steaks in a butcher with above a sign with both Chinese and English writing

props.synopsis: Australian cattle farmers producing wagyu and Angus beef are likely to be among the hardest hit by China's 55 per cent tariff on exports exceeding a 205,000-tonne quota.

title.children: Australian prime beef producers brace for fresh China tariff pain

image.altText: A reading showing a car's extreme speeding.

props.synopsis: Police say two 19-year-old drivers will face court for street racing along Adelaide's Southern Expressway, with one of the P-platers allegedly detected speeding at 209km/h.

title.children: P-plater arrested for alleged street racing at 209km/h on SA expressway

image.altText: A man in dark suit and a woman in blue jacket smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The new role of Western Australia local government inspector Tony Brown includes the ability to send in monitors — as well as legal and financial experts — to stamp out any early signs of trouble.

title.children: Local government inspector sets sights on City Of Perth amid dysfunction

image.altText: An aerial of a cloudy Palm Beach with water, a headland and sand.

props.synopsis: Authorities suspend their searches for a 14-year-old boy and a man in his 20s who went missing off the Sydney coastline this week, following a horror week of drownings.

title.children: Searches called off for teenager and man missing off Sydney beaches

image.altText: Amanda pushes her daughter on a swing at a playground.

props.synopsis: While the exact number of pregnant women who are homeless in Victoria is unknown, experts say the outsized demand for specialty support services indicates more can be done.

title.children: Housing demand for pregnant homeless women outstrips supply, experts say

image.altText: Cars travelling on a busy road, surrounded by grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Police arrest a 61-year-old man after a seven-day investigation involving CCTV, crime scene analysis, forensic examination and witness enquiries.

title.children: Man charged over woman's hit-and-run death on busy NT road

image.altText: A man with short hair looks neutrally at another man who's facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Ukraine's president has named Kyrylo Budanov, a legendary intelligence leader in the country, as the new head of his presidential office.

title.children: Volodymyr Zelenskyy names spy chief as new top aide

image.altText: Tony's Bakery banh mi Cabramatta

props.synopsis: A humble bánh mì appreciation group created by a Sydneysider has played a pivotal role in reinvigorating Australia's love for Vietnamese baguettes.

title.children: 'Bánh mì lover': Vietnamese bakeries go viral on social media
